spatial_accuracy.notes: Bedroom, living/dining, kitchen, toilet, and utility are generally in the correct relative quadrants, but multiple layout details deviate: the foyer area at the main entry is not clearly represented as a distinct space (E1/E2). Several interior wall lines/offsets (notably around the toilet/utility/kitchen junction) do not match the 2D plan’s partitions and duct alignment (E2). Door locations/hinge orientations are inconsistent or absent (toilet/utility), and balcony access is not clearly modeled as in plan (E1/E2). Room proportions appear shifted: living/dining reads oversized while kitchen/utility junction depth/width differs from plan dimensions (E4). Window placement is partially matched on the left façade but does not faithfully reproduce all plan openings/positions (E2).

structural_fidelity.notes: Wall thickness looks visually consistent, but the structural partitioning around the service core (toilet/utility/duct) differs from the plan (E2). Adjacencies are partly correct (kitchen next to utility; bedroom adjacent to toilet), yet the foyer-to-living relationship is altered (foyer not clearly separated) (E1/E2). Toilet and utility doors are not correctly embedded/represented per the 2D door swings (E1/E2/E3). No clear additional full room is added, but the balcony/foyer representation introduces ambiguous/incorrect spatial constructs (E5 risk for the balcony/entry void).

furniture_mapping.notes: Major furniture types roughly correspond (bed in bedroom; dining set in living; kitchen counters/appliances), but placement does not tightly follow the 2D plan (e.g., living seating/TV alignment and balcony-side arrangement) (E2). Scale is generally plausible, though living/dining reads disproportionate relative to furniture compared to the plan (E4).

aesthetic_quality.notes: Isometric view is generally correct and readable. Projection feels mostly consistent, lighting is adequate, and geometry is fairly clean. However, some wall intersections/offsets around the service core look visually awkward/overcomplicated relative to the simple 2D plan (E6), and openings (doors/windows) are not clearly communicated, reducing clarity.

detected_errors.description: Foyer (4'6"x3'10") is not clearly represented as a distinct entry space; main entry appears to open directly into living/dining.
Toilet door is missing or not clearly modeled according to the 2D plan (door swing/leaf not shown).
Utility access door/opening is not clearly represented as in the 2D plan (door/threshold ambiguous).
Service-core wall layout (toilet/duct/utility/kitchen junction) does not match the 2D plan’s partition alignment and offsets.
Balcony configuration and/or connection from living area is not faithfully matched; balcony reads as an ambiguous recessed space rather than the defined 4' wide balcony.

Window placements are only partially consistent; left façade windows appear, but overall window positions/openings do not clearly match the plan (including kitchen/utility/toilet ventilation openings).
Door orientation/hinge logic does not match the 2D plan where doors are present (notably around toilet/utility/entry).
Room proportion distortion: living/dining appears enlarged relative to bedroom and the kitchen/utility zone compared with the plan dimensions.
Minor rendering/clarity artifact: interior openings (doors/windows) are not clearly delineated, making structural reading weaker than the 2D plan.
